job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
**REMOTE OPPORTUNITY - U.S. ONLY**
About Wellory: Diets don't work, experts do.
📲 Wellory delivers 1-1 personalized nutrition coaching to help you build healthier habits and reach your goals for good. Think of us like a therapist for your relationship with food.
We’re on a mission to make personalized nutrition accessible for all—and we won't stop until we make an insane impact (like drastically reducing the number of people who get sick every year from diet-related disease). We're grateful to be on this journey with some of the world's best investors including Story Ventures, Harlem Capital, Co-Founders of Tinder, NBA Player Wayne Ellington, Wellness guru Hannah Bronfman, leaders from Glossier, Google, Amazon, amongst others (learn more here).
🌟 We're a remote team with a concentration in New York and San Francisco. While we may be distant, we're all brand-obsessed and looking for the next go-getter to join our family. If you have what it takes to build the next biggest consumer tech company (think world domination while wearing head-to-toe Wellory gear), we'd love to meet you!
What We're Looking For
👋 Wellory is seeking an ambitious, passion-driven, self-motivated Software Engineer to join as the first in-house hire on our growing engineer team. You'll collaborate with engineers, designers, and product to deliver value to Wellory's growing user base of clients and nutrition coaches. You must be comfortable in a fast-paced, agile environment (like, really fast) and able to wear both strategy and execution hats.
What your responsibilities will be ✅
Full-stack development with a focus on back-end
Write understandable, testable code with a focus on maintainability and scalability
Collaborate with a remote development team, review code, test features, and champion bug-free releases
Have control over infrastructure, core emphasis on CI and data integrity and general sense of ownership on tech
Promote constant refactoring while developing features or touching existing code to keep the codebase as clean as possible
Promote iterative development, using best practices such as feature toggles, test automation, and monitoring in order to ensure confidence in our release process
Active engagement in technical discussions during architecture meetings, code reviews, and product/design meetings to help promote a culture of learning and continuous improvement
Ability to identify trade-offs, challenge ideas, over-communicate and effectively collaborate with teammates
Become a domain expert, working closely with our product team and stakeholders
Help scale and monitor our services (AWS)
Who we're looking for 🦄
3-5 years of software development experience
Must have experience working with a remote development team
Experience with Nodejs, MongoDB, and AWS
Experience with at least 2 of the following languages/frameworks: Typescript, React, Angular, Swift, and/or Kotlin
Passion for technology, innovation, continued learning, and above all, driving value for our end users
Strong understanding of agile, lean and DevOps principles
Strong understanding of testing and ability to bring ideas to improve QA standards
Comfortable working in high growth, fast-paced environments, and can easily adapt to change
Strong understanding of industry best practices and standards
Comfortable working with an offshore team, communicating and collaborating across timezones
Incredible attention to detail and dedication to quality
Bonus
: Experience with python, data pipelines, ML technologies or processing data into a form suitable for analysis and reporting
Pro tip
: you've done your research on Wellory before your first interview!
Why you might be excited about us 🕺
We're
really
changing people's lives and helping them live healthier, happier, longer. We're doing important work that helps people create behavior change — and that excites you daily.
You're hungry to make REAL impact every single day — you're motivated by progress and know that the work you do will move the needle.
You're excited to be one of the first ten employees of a startup — you see the path forward and you're eager to be a part of the journey.
You are a team-player who is able to thrive in ambiguity. You love tackling new projects and building the playbook from scratch. This is not the kind of job where you show up and we tell you exactly what to do every day (micromanagement makes you cringe).
Why you might
not
be excited about us 👀
We're a lean, mean fighting machine (under 10 employees). If you like a more established company setting, this role isn't for you.
We're a remote-first company, and therefore fantastic communication skills (verbal and written) is vital. If you don't like to over-communicate, you won't be happy here.
We're an early-stage startup. Projects and priorities are likely to shift. If you're not keen on flexibility and a "learn while we go" mentality, you may get frustrated easily.
Everyone on the team is extremely mission-driven, and works incredibly hard to push towards our lofty vision. If you prefer a 9-5 job or to rest-and-vest, this job isn't for you.
As the very first in-house engineer, you'll be an owner and an operator. If that doesn't excite you, then we're not a good match.
We deeply believe teamwork makes the dream work. If you're not willing to lend a hand wherever it's needed (and sometimes that means it may be outside of your job description), you won't fit in.
Life as a Weep 😀
All Wellory team members are referred to as "Weeps"
WFH Office set up ☕ — you'll get a new computer + equipment to work comfortably while remote
Full health insurance coverage, including dental and vision
Unlimited vaca — we mean it 💃💃💃
Monthly team events — we're a team that loves to celebrate and spend quality time together. While we may be remote, we plan monthly fun, zoom-style happy hours, team bonding events, virtual comedy shows +more!
The interview process 👋🏽👋👋🏿
We'll do our best to respond to all applications as quickly as possible.
First Call -
If it's a match, we'll invite you to chat with our CEO + Founder, Emily, on a 1-hour call to learn more about the company and so we can learn more about you!
Second Call
- If we all get along, you'll move to a second call with our CPO + Co-Founder Jeni, to dive into the role and learn more about our products and tech team.
Take-home Assessment -
Next, you’ll be given a take-home assignment to help us understand how you think, work, and communicate. We value hard work first and foremost!
Meet Our Advisor
- Then you'll chat with our technical advisor Jason to dive into technical experience and development at Wellory.
Final Chat -
You'll have one final interview with Jeni to recap learnings and answer any outstanding questions.
References
- Last step, we'll reach out to people who you've worked with and hear what it's like working alongside you!
